text:
cover in Chapters 9 and 10, respectively .
Exercises
2.1 We consider (R\{−1},⋆), where
a⋆b := ab+ a+ b, a,b ∈R\{−1} (2.134)
a. Show that (R\{−1},⋆) is an Abelian group.
b. Solve
3 ⋆x⋆x = 15
in the Abelian group (R\{−1},⋆), where ⋆is deﬁned in (2.134).
